byline.original: By MICHAEL SCHWIRTZ and MICHAEL WINERIP

abstract: Violent campaign of retribution against prisoners at Clinton Correctional Facility appears to have taken place in wake of escape of inmates Richard W Matt and David P Sweat; one guard, known by inmates as Captain America and who allegedly brutally beat inmates, has been identified as gang intelligence officer Chad Stickney; prisoners say guards repeatedly assaulted them during interrogations following escape.
lead_paragraph: Inmates at Clinton Correctional Facility, the prison from which two men escaped in June, have identified the guard as Chad Stickney, who has been accused of choking an inmate. He has not been charged.

headline.main: Prison Inmates Put a Name to a Feared Guard Known as Captain America
headline.print_headline: In Beatings, Inmates Feared a ‘Captain America’

snippet: Inmates at Clinton Correctional Facility, the prison from which two men escaped in June, have identified the guard as Chad Stickney, who has been accused of choking an inmate. He has not been charged.
